title: 111_hr3413
content: The "Rural Information Technology Investment Act" is cited as the short title. Grants for rural information technology centers are provided under the National Telecommunications and Information Administration Organization Act. The NTIA will provide grants to eligible entities for establishing information technology centers in rural areas. Eligible entities include small businesses, not-for-profit organizations, and government entities serving rural areas. Applicants must submit an application with a matching fund requirement of at least 15%. NTIA will prioritize grants under this Act. The NTIA will prioritize grants for eligible entities promoting IT research at rural higher education institutions, located in high-unemployment counties, certified HUBZone small businesses, or collaborating with local Workforce Investment Boards. The NTIA will prioritize grants for eligible entities promoting IT research at rural higher education institutions, located in high-unemployment counties, certified HUBZone small businesses, or collaborating with local Workforce Investment Boards. Grants awarded will be determined based on existing broadband service capability, availability, and other relevant factors. Recipients will undergo audits administered by the NTIA. The NTIA will conduct audits and report findings to Congress annually. $10,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 2010-2012. Definitions include 'information technology,' 'information technology center,' and 'rural area.' The term 'rural area' is defined as any area that is not a city or town with a population greater than 50,000 inhabitants, and not the urbanized area adjacent to such a city or town.
